title: Build Responsive Real-World Websites with HTML and CSS
short_title: Responsive Web Design with HTML & CSS
description: The #1 bestselling HTML and CSS course. Learn to design and build a stunning real-world project from scratch using modern HTML5, CSS3, Flexbox, and CSS Grid.

instructor.name: Jonas Schmedtmann
instructor.title: Web Developer, Designer, and Teacher
instructor.bio: Experienced web developer and designer, and one of Udemy's top instructors teaching over 200,000 developers.

learning_points: Become a modern and confident HTML and CSS developer, no prior knowledge needed!
Design and build a stunning real-world project for your portfolio from scratch
Modern, semantic and accessible HTML5
Modern CSS (previous CSS3), including flexbox and CSS Grid for layout
Important CSS concepts such as the box model, positioning schemes, inheritance, solving selector conflicts, etc.
A web design framework with easy-to-use rules and guidelines to design eye-catching websites
How to plan, sketch, design, build, test, and optimize a professional website
How to make websites work on every possible mobile device (responsive design)
How to use common components and layout patterns for professional website design and development
Developer skills such as reading documentation, debugging, and using professional tools
How to find and use free design assets such as images, fonts, and icons
Practice your skills with 10+ challenges (solutions included)

description: The most advanced and modern CSS course on the internet: master flexbox, CSS Grid, responsive design, and CSS architecture.

instructor.name: Jonas Schmedtmann

learning_points: Tons of modern CSS techniques to create stunning designs and effects
Advanced CSS animations with @keyframes, animation and transition

Responsive images in HTML and CSS for faster pageloads

title: The Complete JavaScript Course 2025: From Zero to Expert
description: The modern JavaScript course for everyone! Master JavaScript with projects, challenges and theory. Includes 6 real-world projects, asynchronous JS, OOP, and modern tools.

instructor.name: Jonas Schmedtmann
instructor.title: Web Developer, Designer, and Teacher
instructor.bio: Experienced web developer and designer, one of Udemy's top instructors with over 850,000 students.

learning_points: Become an advanced, confident, and modern JavaScript developer from scratch
Build 6 beautiful real-world projects for your portfolio (not boring toy apps)
Become job-ready by understanding how JavaScript really works behind the scenes
How to think and work like a developer: problem-solving, researching, workflows
JavaScript fundamentals: variables, if/else, operators, boolean logic, functions, arrays, objects, loops, strings, etc.
Modern ES6+ from the beginning: arrow functions, destructuring, spread operator, optional chaining (ES2020), etc.
Modern OOP: Classes, constructors, prototypal inheritance, encapsulation, etc.
Complex concepts like the 'this' keyword, higher-order functions, closures, etc.
Asynchronous JavaScript: Event loop, promises, async/await, AJAX calls and APIs
How to architect your code using flowcharts and common patterns
Modern tools for 2022 and beyond: NPM, Parcel, Babel and ES6 modules
Practice your skills with 50+ challenges and assignments (solutions included)

title: English for IT 1
description: The first of two courses teaching English in an IT context. It focuses on industry terminology, grammar, and communication skills to bridge the gap between B1 and B2 proficiency, preparing learners for the English for IT certification.

instructor.name: Cisco Networking Academy / OpenEDG
instructor.title: Professional Skills Learning Collection
instructor.bio: Developed in collaboration with OpenEDG to equip learners with high-demand English language skills for the global IT industry.

learning_points: Master essential IT terminology used in Product Management, Networking, and Security
Learn advanced grammar like Passive Voice, Inversion, and Future Perfect in a technical context
Improve listening comprehension through real-world scenarios like UX discussions and fraudulent call analysis
Develop technical reading skills with texts on compilers, interpreters, and security policies
Understand how to give polite requests and advice to customers and colleagues
Prepare for the English for IT B2/GSE 59-75 certification exam
Learn to identify issues and incorporate professional goals into discussions

title: English for IT 2
description: A course that teaches the English language in a specific IT context at the B2 proficiency level. Developed in collaboration with OpenEDG, it focuses on terminology, grammar, and communication skills valued in the IT industry.

instructor.name: Cisco Networking Academy / OpenEDG
instructor.title: Professional Skills Learning Collection
instructor.bio: Developed in collaboration with OpenEDG to equip learners with English language skills for employment in IT.

learning_points: Develop B2-level English proficiency in an IT context
Master advanced grammar including the subjunctive mood, cleft sentences, and logical deduction
Learn industry-specific terminology for Network Engineers, Software Engineers, and Product Managers
Improve professional listening skills through IT-themed training sessions and test reports
Enhance reading comprehension with technical texts on protocols, Cloud Computing, and Unix/Ubuntu
Gain confidence in defending points of view and providing polite feedback to colleagues
Prepare for the English for IT B2/GSE 59-75 certification exam
